name: Aid Dependency
title: Highest Net ODA Received
description: In 2020, Somalia received the highest net official development assistance (ODA) as a percentage of its central government expenses, highlighting its reliance on international aid.

name: Debt Dilemma
title: 100% Multilateral Debt Service
description: As of 2023, Somalia's multilateral debt service accounted for 100% of its public and publicly guaranteed debt service, indicating a significant financial burden.

name: Water for Crops
title: Dominant Agricultural Water Use
description: In 2021, 99.48% of Somalia's annual freshwater withdrawals were used for agriculture, emphasizing the sector's critical role in the nation's water consumption.

name: Import Duty Heavy
title: High Customs Duties
description: In 2023, customs and other import duties made up 67.57% of Somalia's tax revenue, reflecting a heavy reliance on import taxation.

name: Air Quality Concerns
title: High Particulate Emission Damage
description: In 2021, particulate emission damage accounted for 7.09% of Somalia's GNI, indicating significant environmental challenges.

name: Cultural Challenge
title: High Female Genital Mutilation Prevalence
description: In 2020, 99.2% of Somali women were affected by female genital mutilation, highlighting a critical social issue.

name: Food Insecurity
title: High Undernourishment Prevalence
description: In 2022, 51.3% of Somalia's population was undernourished, pointing to severe food security challenges.

name: Baby Boom
title: High Fertility Rate
description: In 2023, Somalia had a fertility rate of 6.13 births per woman, indicating a rapidly growing population.

name: Young Female Population
title: High Percentage of Young Females
description: In 2023, 18.32% of Somalia's female population was aged 0-4, reflecting a youthful demographic.

name: Global Trade Connections
title: High Imports from Low- and Middle-Income Economies
description: In 2023, 75.32% of Somalia's merchandise imports came from low- and middle-income economies outside its region, showcasing diverse trade connections.

name: Arab World Export Focus
title: High Exports to the Arab World
description: In 2023, 90.84% of Somalia's merchandise exports were directed to the Arab World, highlighting a strong regional trade focus.

name: Water Wise
title: Efficient Water Use
description: In 2021, Somalia's domestic freshwater withdrawals accounted for only 0.45% of total freshwater withdrawal, showcasing a highly efficient use of water resources.

name: Revenue Riddle
title: Minimal Revenue Generation
description: Somalia's revenue, excluding grants, was a mere 0.00011% of GDP in 2023, indicating a significant challenge in generating internal revenue.

name: Tax Troubles
title: Low Tax Revenue
description: In 2023, tax revenue in Somalia was only 0.00008% of GDP, highlighting a critical need for tax system reforms.

name: Trademark Triumph
title: Trademark Applications by Nonresidents
description: In 2021, Somalia received 140 trademark applications from nonresidents, indicating some level of international business interest.

name: Governance Gap
title: Low Property Rights and Governance Rating
description: Somalia scored 1 out of 6 in the CPIA property rights and rule-based governance rating in 2023, reflecting significant governance challenges.

name: Logistics Lag
title: Inefficient Customs and Logistics
description: With a customs efficiency score of 1.5 and logistics competence score of 1.8 in 2022, Somalia faces substantial logistical challenges.

name: Trade Deficit Dilemma
title: Negative External Balance
description: In 2023, Somalia's external balance on goods and services was -162,215,385,473,200 LCU, indicating a significant trade deficit.

name: Law and Order Lapse
title: Low Rule of Law
description: Somalia's rule of law estimate was -2.21 in 2023, placing it among the lowest in global rankings.

name: Education Enigma
title: Low School Enrollment
description: In 2023, primary school enrollment was 21.2%, with secondary enrollment at 3.3%, indicating significant educational challenges.

name: Health Hurdles
title: Limited Prenatal and Birth Care
description: Only 31.1% of pregnant women received prenatal care, and 31.9% of births were attended by skilled staff in 2019, highlighting healthcare access issues.

name: Vaccination Victory
title: Newborns Protected Against Tetanus
description: In 2023, 50% of newborns in Somalia were protected against tetanus, showing progress in vaccination efforts.

name: Contraceptive Conundrum
title: Low Contraceptive Use
description: In 2019, only 6.9% of married women used any contraceptive method, indicating a need for improved family planning services.

name: Birth Registration Blues
title: Incomplete Birth Registration
description: In 2020, only 7.2% of urban births were registered, highlighting a gap in civil registration systems.
